trans-unit.source: Copying an Existing Blob into a Media Services Asset
trans-unit.target: Copying an Existing Blob into a Media Services Asset

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to copy an existing blob into a Media Services Asset.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to copy an existing blob into a Media Services Asset.

trans-unit.source: Copying an Existing Blob into a Media Services Asset
trans-unit.target: Copying an Existing Blob into a Media Services Asset

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to copy blobs from a storage account into a new Microsoft Azure Media Services asset.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to copy blobs from a storage account into a new Microsoft Azure Media Services asset.

trans-unit.source: Your blobs could exist in a storage account that is associated with Media Services account, or storage account that is not associated with Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: Your blobs could exist in a storage account that is associated with Media Services account, or storage account that is not associated with Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: This topic demonstrates how to copy blobs from a storage account into a Media Services Asset.
trans-unit.target: This topic demonstrates how to copy blobs from a storage account into a Media Services Asset.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can also copy across Data Centers.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can also copy across Data Centers.

trans-unit.source: However, there may be charges incurred by doing so.
trans-unit.target: However, there may be charges incurred by doing so.

trans-unit.source: For more information about pricing, see [Data Transfers](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/#header-11).
trans-unit.target: For more information about pricing, see [Data Transfers](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/#header-11).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You should not attempt to change the contents of blob containers that were generated by Media Services without using Media Service APIs.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You should not attempt to change the contents of blob containers that were generated by Media Services without using Media Service APIs.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Two Media Services accounts in a new or existing Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Two Media Services accounts in a new or existing Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See the topic [How to Create a Media Services Account](media-services-create-account.md).
trans-unit.target: See the topic [How to Create a Media Services Account](media-services-create-account.md).

trans-unit.source: Operating Systems: Windows 7, Windows 2008 R2, or Windows 8.
trans-unit.target: Operating Systems: Windows 7, Windows 2008 R2, or Windows 8.

trans-unit.source: .NET Framework 4.5.
trans-unit.target: .NET Framework 4.5.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013, Visual Studio 2012 or Visual Studio 2010 SP1 (Professional, Premium, Ultimate, or Express).
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013, Visual Studio 2012 or Visual Studio 2010 SP1 (Professional, Premium, Ultimate, or Express).

trans-unit.source: Set up your project
trans-unit.target: Set up your project

trans-unit.source: In this section you will create and set up a C# Console Application project.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will create and set up a C# Console Application project.

trans-unit.source: Use Visual Studio 2012 or Visual Studio 2010 SP1 to create a new solution that contains the C# Console Application project.
trans-unit.target: Use Visual Studio 2012 or Visual Studio 2010 SP1 to create a new solution that contains the C# Console Application project.

trans-unit.source: Enter CopyExistingBlobsIntoAsset for the Name and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Enter CopyExistingBlobsIntoAsset for the Name and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Use Nuget to add references to Media Services related DLLs.
trans-unit.target: Use Nuget to add references to Media Services related DLLs.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio Main Menu, select TOOLS -> Library Package Manager -> Package Manager Console.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio Main Menu, select TOOLS -> Library Package Manager -> Package Manager Console.

trans-unit.source: In the console window type Install-Package windowsazure.mediaservices and press enter.
trans-unit.target: In the console window type Install-Package windowsazure.mediaservices and press enter.

trans-unit.source: Add other references that are required for this project: System.Configuration.
trans-unit.target: Add other references that are required for this project: System.Configuration.

trans-unit.source: Replace using statements that were added to the Programs.cs file by default with the following ones:
trans-unit.target: Replace using statements that were added to the Programs.cs file by default with the following ones:

trans-unit.source: Add the appSettings section to the .config file and update the values based on your Media Services and Storage key and name values.
trans-unit.target: Add the appSettings section to the .config file and update the values based on your Media Services and Storage key and name values.

trans-unit.source: Copy Blobs from a Storage Account into a Media Services Asset
trans-unit.target: Copy Blobs from a Storage Account into a Media Services Asset

trans-unit.source: The code example below performs the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: The code example below performs the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: Creates the CloudMediaContext instance.
trans-unit.target: Creates the CloudMediaContext instance.

trans-unit.source: Creates CloudStorageAccount instances: _sourceStorageAccount and _destinationStorageAccount.
trans-unit.target: Creates CloudStorageAccount instances: _sourceStorageAccount and _destinationStorageAccount.

trans-unit.source: Uploads Smooth Streaming files from a local directory into a blob container that is located in _sourceStorageAccount.
trans-unit.target: Uploads Smooth Streaming files from a local directory into a blob container that is located in _sourceStorageAccount.

trans-unit.source: Creates a new asset.
trans-unit.target: Creates a new asset.

trans-unit.source: The blob container that that is created for this asset is located in _destinationStorageAccount.
trans-unit.target: The blob container that that is created for this asset is located in _destinationStorageAccount.

trans-unit.source: Uses Azure Storage SDK to copy the specified blobs into the container associated with the asset.
trans-unit.target: Uses Azure Storage SDK to copy the specified blobs into the container associated with the asset.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]The copy operation does not throw an exception if the locator has expired.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]The copy operation does not throw an exception if the locator has expired.

trans-unit.source: Sets the .ism file to be the primary file.
trans-unit.target: Sets the .ism file to be the primary file.

trans-unit.source: Creates the Smooth Streaming URL for the OnDemandOrigin locator associated with the asset.
trans-unit.target: Creates the Smooth Streaming URL for the OnDemandOrigin locator associated with the asset.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
